headline: IBM in Focus as Bernstein Maintains Neutral Stance After Confluent Acquisition
summary: International Business Machines Corporation (NYSE:IBM) is one of the AI Stocks Analysts Are Watching Closely. On December 10, Bernstein SocGen Group reiterated its Market Perform rating on the stock with a price target of $280.00. Firm analysts remain neutral on the stock despite IBM’s acquisition announcement noting that even though it sees strategic alignment, overall view […]

headline: Why HR Departments Often Don’t Live Up to Employees’ Expectations
summary: On one hand, HR departments are frequently tasked with recruiting and hiring the best people possible and, ideally, helping these individuals succeed at, and be fulfilled by, their jobs.  To look at what HR departments do—and don’t do—well, we spoke with Allison Elias, assistant professor of business administration at the Darden School of Business at the University of Virginia and author of “The Rise of Corporate Feminism,” which looks at the development of human resource management in the latter half of the 20th century.  ALLISON ELIAS: The HR we know today—with credentialed professionals managing tasks like hiring and firing, benefits, training, grievances—didn’t really come along until the 1980s.

headline: Quantum Computing Could Bring Bitcoin Chaos. Rush Is On To Stop Crypto-geddon.
summary: Quantum computing threatens to upend the cryptography that secures bitcoin and all blockchain-based digital assets, such as stablecoins.

headline: Weekly Recap: 13 Tech Press Releases You Need to See
summary: With thousands of press releases published each week, it can be difficult to keep up with everything on PR Newswire. To help tech journalists and consumers stay on top of the week's most newsworthy and popular releases, here's a recap of some major stories from the week that shouldn't be missed.

headline: IoT Technologies Set to Revolutionize Port Operations from 2025
summary: The global smart port market is expected to soar to USD 7.95 billion by 2030 from USD 2.23 billion in 2024, showcasing a CAGR of 25.8%. With over 80% of global trade by volume shipped via ocean, ports are under pressure to modernize to meet rising demands fueled by e-commerce and nearshoring. Technologies like AI analytics, IoT for asset tracking, and blockchain are key for increased efficiency, shortened turnaround times, and reduced carbon emissions.
